JUDGES: Anatoly Kovler;Dean Spielmann;Elisabeth Steiner;George Nicolaou;Giorgio Malinverni;Khanlar Hajiyev
TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is an NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE . He was represented before the Court by PERSON , PERSON , PERSON and PERSON , a firm of lawyers practising in PERSON . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent , Ambassador PERSON , Head of ORG at ORG .

On DATE , preliminary investigations ( Vorerhebungen ) were instituted against the applicant and CARDINAL other persons who were suspected of aggravated fraud , breach of trust , money laundering and forming a criminal organisation .

During these proceedings ORG ( PERSON ) acting through its competent investigating judge , on DATE confiscated CARDINAL cars belonging to the applicant by an interim measure under section CARDINALa of the Code of Criminal Procedure ( NORP - ordnung ) in order to secure the levy ( GPE ) of property presumed to have been obtained by criminal acts . The court confiscated a Suzuki Kombi , a ORG Voyager Kombi and a Mercedes Cabrio . On CARDINAL DATE the court further ordered that the cars be kept at a motor trading company in GPE . It dismissed the applicant ’s argument that his friend and not he was the owner of ORG .
The applicant did not appeal against this decision .

On DATE ORG convicted the applicant of aggravated professional fraud and being a member of a criminal organisation . Under LAW ) it found that there should be a levy on the enrichment obtained from the crimes in the amount of CARDINAL,CARDINAL.CARDINAL euros ( ORG ) . The applicant made a plea of nullity to ORG . The applicant and ORG also filed appeals against the sentence .

On DATE the court , referring inter alia to section CARDINAL of LAW ( Exekutionsordnung ) , ordered that the cars be sold at public judicial auction . It noted that the criminal proceedings were very complex and that ORG would presumably not render judgment until DATE . The sale of the cars was necessary in order to prevent excessive parking charges and loss of value due to the ORG decreasing sales value . The court finally noted that the interests of the car owner were protected by the fact that he could recover the cars by participating in the judicial auction . Furthermore , he would obtain the proceeds of the sale revenue if no levy would be imposed . The decision was served on the applicant ’s counsel on DATE . No formal remedy lies against this decision .

Nevertheless , the applicant , assisted by counsel , lodged an appeal on DATE . He submitted that the reasons given for the sale were not plausible , as the cars had until now been kept for CARDINAL , and considerable parking charges had accrued . Therefore , the fact that the cars should be kept for DATE was of minor importance . He was not in a position to buy the cars at the judicial auction as he was currently living on emergency assistance ( Notstandshilfe ) . Furthermore , there was not sufficient legal basis for the court ’s decision to sell his property . The applicant finally argued that he was not the owner of the ORG Kombi and that the court had failed to inform the real owner .

On CARDINAL DATE ORG ( Oberlandesgericht ) rejected the appeal as inadmissible , as no appeal lay against such an order . It noted that the provisions of LAW alone were relevant and section CARDINALa § CARDINAL of LAW only provided for the right to appeal against a decision ordering or cancelling an interim confiscation . This decision was served on the applicant ’s counsel on DATE .
On DATE the cars were sold at a public auction .
On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s plea of nullity against ORG judgment of DATE and , on CARDINAL DATE , ORG dismissed the appeals lodged by the applicant and ORG .

Under LAW of LAW ) a person who has obtained property of value by or as a result of criminal acts should be sentenced to a fine in the amount of the unlawful enrichment . If the exact extent of the enrichment can not be established or can only be established by incurring disproportionate costs , the court has to assess the amount to be levied on an equitable basis .

In case of suspicion of unlawful enrichment , presumably falling under the scope of LAW , and if there is reason to assume that otherwise the levy on the value of the property concerned is thereby placed at risk , section CARDINALa § CARDINAL of the Code of Criminal Procedure ( PERSON ) authorises the investigating judge , at the request of ORG , to issue an interim order of confiscation .
Section CARDINALa § CARDINAL further provides that , if not stipulated otherwise , the provisions of LAW ( Exekutionsordnung ) apply to these interim measures .

Section CARDINALa § CARDINAL provides that ORG , the accused and any other person concerned have the right to appeal to the second - instance court against a decision ordering or cancelling an interim confiscation .

Section CARDINAL § CARDINAL of LAW provides that , upon request , the court may issue any orders which are necessary to prevent obsolescence , disproportional costs or other losses concerning objects which belong to third parties and have been taken into legal custody . According to the legal doctrine , such a decision may also consist in the order to sell the objects concerned .
